reg:regulation.reg:title: Training Tax Credits Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [Last amended December 1, 2022 by B.C. Reg. 253/2022 and includes amendments by B.C. Reg. 268/2022]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Income Tax Act;
complete level 1, in relation to a program, means the completion of the level 1 requirements established by SkilledTradesBC and as amended from time to time for the program;
complete level 2, in relation to a program, means the completion of the level 2 requirements established by SkilledTradesBC and as amended from time to time for the program;
complete level 3, in relation to a program, means the completion of the level 3 requirements established by SkilledTradesBC and as amended from time to time for the program;
complete level 4, in relation to a program, means the completion of the level 4 requirements established by SkilledTradesBC and as amended from time to time for the program;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to an eligible recognized program set out in Schedule 1, to receive one of the following for completing the program:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if a Certificate of Qualification is not granted for that program, a Certificate of Apprenticeship, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to an eligible training program set out in section 4 (5) or in Schedule 2, to receive one of the following for completing the program:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if a Certificate of Qualification is not granted for that program, a Certificate of Apprenticeship;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: work-based hours, in relation to a number of work-based hours completed, means work-based hours shown as completed on a transcript from SkilledTradesBC.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The recognized programs set out in Column 1 of Schedule 1 are prescribed for the purposes of the definition of "eligible recognized program" in section 116 of the Act.
The accredited programs and recognized programs set out in Column 1 of Schedule 2 are prescribed for the purposes of the definition of "eligible training program" in section 116 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The level 1 requirements, if any, established for an eligible recognized program itemized in Column 1 of Schedule 1 are the requirements set out opposite that item in Column 2.
The level 2 requirements, if any, established for an eligible recognized program itemized in Column 1 of Schedule 1 are the requirements set out opposite that item in Column 3.
The level 3 requirements, if any, established for an eligible training program itemized in Column 1 of Schedule 2 are the requirements set out opposite that item in Column 2.
The level 4 requirements, if any, established for an eligible training program itemized in Column 1 of Schedule 2 are the requirements set out opposite that item in Column 3.
The level 5 requirement established for the following eligible training programs is to graduate from the program:

bcl:centertext.in:em:
(prescribed eligible recognized programs, section 2;
level 1 and level 2 requirements; section 4 (1) and (2))

oasis:entry.oasis:line: automotive wheel alignment and brake service technician
boom truck operator — folding boom unlimited tonnage
boom truck operator — stiff boom unlimited tonnage
graphic arts — litho pressperson (web, sheet fed, rotary and gravure)
mobile crane operator — hydraulic 80 tonnes and under
mobile crane operator — hydraulic unlimited tonnage

bcl:centertext.in:em:
(prescribed eligible training programs, section 3;
level 3 and level 4 requirements; section 4 (3) and (4))

oasis:entry.oasis:line: graphic arts — litho pressperson (web, sheet fed, rotary and gravure)
motor vehicle body repairer (metal and paint)

bcl:footnote.bcl:text: 2010-18-33 changed enacting authority to the Commissioner of Income Tax.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Income Tax Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 215, s. 131.]
